AUG04010-d-08-25-04-CMC.Narrative: THE CREW WAS IN THE PROCESS OF MAKING UP MISJOINTS IN TRACK 608.  AS THEY WERE SHOVING BACK TO ANOTHER JOINT, THERE WAS RADIO INTERFERENCE FROM ANOTHER CREW.  THE ENGINEER WAS GIVEN A COUNT TO THE JOINT AND DID NOT STOP WITHIN HALF THE DISTANCE SPECIFIED, WHEN HE DID NOT GET FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS.  THERE WAS A HARD JOINT MADE, BUT THE JOINT DID NOT MAKE UP SINCE THE KNUCKLES WERE BUTTED.  THIS CAUSED THE CARS TO ROLL OUT THE END OF TRACK 608 AND INTO THE SIDE OF BNSF 101 SITTING ON THE LEAD TO TRACK 609.  THE CREW WAS NOT SHOVING THE TRACK BACK, SO NO ONE NEEDED TO BE AHEAD OF THE MOVEMENT.

ID04352-d-08-03-04-KYLE.Narrative: CREW HAD CUT OFF THEIR TRAIN EAST OF ESBON AND HAD ORDERS TO PULL 24 ASPHALT CARS OFF THE SIDING.  THEY PULLED 11 CARS OFF THE TRACK FIRST AND SET OVER TO THE MAIN.  THEY THEN WENT BACK INTO THE SIDING TRACK TO PULL THE 24 THEY NEEDED.  THEY MADE THE JOINT AND PULLED AHEAD 980 FEET WHEN THEY WENT INTO EMERGENCY.THE CREW FOUND THE 14TH THROUGH THE 18TH CAR HAD DERAILED AND WERE LAYING ON THEIR SIDES.  THE CARS WERE LOADED WITH HOT ASPHALT SO EMERGENCY RESPONSE PERSONNEL WERE NOTIFIED AND PRECAUTIONS TAKEN.  THERE WAS NO DISCHARGE OF MATERIAL AND THE CARS WERE SAFELY RERAILED WITH NO LOSS OF PRODUCT.

I0404-d-08-29-04-PATH.Accident Cause: Flagging, improper or failure to flag
I0404-d-08-29-04-PATH.Narrative: TWO SWITCHMEN WERE MOVING A SEVEN CAR CONSIST (602-178-127-706-717-107-753) ONTO TRACK 2 IN HARRISONYARD ADDING TO A SECOND SEVEN CAR CONSIST(649-104-625-712-136-142-697).  SWITCHMAN 1 WAS FLAGGING IN CAR 602, AND SWITCHMAN 2 WAS OPERATING IN REVERSE FROM CAR 753.  SWITCHMAN 1 SAYS HE GAVE THREE BUZZES TO SWITCHMAN 2 INDICATING THREE CAR LENGTHS.  HE BUZZED HIM TWO, THEN ONE.  WHEN HE RECEIVED NORESPONSE, HE DUMPED THE TRAIN AS IT WAS ABOUT TO STOP.  SWITCHMAN 2 WHEN QUESTIONED STATED HE HEARDONLY THREE BUZZES.  THE TRAIN STRUCK THE SECOND CONSIST CAUSING A HARD ADD AND DAMAGE OF $15,748.BOTH EMPLOYEES WERE SENT FOR DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING.  ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  THE CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE IMPROPER FLAGGING BY SWITCHMAN 1.

CREW WALKED TRAIN AND FOUND TWO CARS DERAILED ON THEIR SIDE.  CARS DERAILED 15 CAR LENGTHS NORTH OF TIPPLE ON TRACK #2.  DERAILED CARS SUSTAINEDAN ESTIMATED $25,000 IN DAMAGE.

308604-d-08-14-04-WC.Narrative: THE UP WAS SHOVING A HUMP CUT OUT OF TRACK 12.  A SECOND CUT WAS BEING POSITIONED ON TRACK 3.  THE OPERATOR OF THE LOCOMOTIVE STOPPED THE MOVEMENT, BUT CARS CONTINUED TO ROLL OUT INTO THE SIDE OF CARSCOMING OUT OF TRACK 12.  CAR BKTY 121497 DERAILED INTO THE SIDE OF LOCOMOTIVE CSXT7692 OCCUPIED BYWC CREW.

A04001-d-08-26-04-WTJR.Narrative: FOUR LOADED CARS WERE BEING SHOVED INTO TRACK 711 WHEN ENGINEER FELT FOUR SHORT JERKS.  PUT THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY BUT WAS TOO LATE.  CAR UP 91477, LOADED WITH GRAIN, WAS DERAILED.  UPON INSPECTIONIT WAS FOUND THAT A 2` SECTION OF THE INSIDE RAIL HEAD HAD BROKEN OUT LEAVING A BLUNT END.  THIS ISWHERE THE FLANGE OF THE WHEEL CLIMBED THE RAIL AND CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.
